pli-tv-pvr16:8.1: (): _Payogassāti cīvaradhovanādino sattavidhassa pubbakaraṇassatthāya yo udakāharaṇādiko payogo kayirati, tassa payogassa_, “_Payogassa_: the effort of fetching water, etc., done for the sake of the seven-fold prior actions, beginning with washing the robe: for that effort.”
pli-tv-pvr16:8.7: (): _Vatthussāti saṅghāṭiādino kathinavatthussa_, “_Vatthussa_: the basis/object of the robe-making ceremony, which is the upper robe, etc.”
pli-tv-pvr16:21.2: (): _Kiriyā majjheti paccuddhāro ceva adhiṭṭhānañca_, “_Kiriyā majjhe_: just relinquishing and determining.”
pli-tv-pvr16:24.6: (): _Vatthuvipannaṃ hotīti akappiyadussaṃ hoti. Kālavipannaṃ nāma ajja dāyakehi dinnaṃ sve saṅgho kathinatthārakassa deti. Karaṇavipannaṃ nāma tadaheva chinditvā akataṃ_, “_Vatthuvipannaṃ hoti_: the cloth is unallowable. _Kālavipannaṃ_: today it is given by the donors; tomorrow the Sangha will give to the one who is to do the robe-making ceremony. _Karaṇavipannaṃ_: they cut it on that day, but do not finish it.”
pli-tv-pvr16:54.5: According to the commentary, (), this refers to the legal procedure done by the Sangha to end the robe season before its natural end.
